solution:
```python
import heapq

def train_king(nab, nba, ab_trains, ba_trains):
    ab_trains.sort(key=lambda x: x[1])
    ba_trains.sort(key=lambda x: x[1])

    ab_index = 0
    ba_index = 0
    max_units = 0
    pq = []

    while ab_index < nab or ba_index < nba:
        if ab_index < nab and (ba_index == nba or ab_trains[ab_index][1] <= ba_trains[ba_index][1]):
            heapq.heappush(pq, (ab_trains[ab_index][1], ab_trains[ab_index][2], ab_trains[ab_index][0]))
            ab_index += 1
        if ba_index < nba and (ab_index == nab or ba_trains[ba_index][1] <= ab_trains[ab_index][1]):
            heapq.heappush(pq, (ba_trains[ba_index][1], ba_trains[ba_index][2], -ba_trains[ba_index][0]))
            ba_index += 1

        if pq:
            _, _, units = heapq.heappop(pq)
            max_units += units
            if units > 0:
                for i in range(1, units):
                    heapq.heappush(pq, (ab_trains[ab_index-1][1], ab_trains[ab_index-1][2], ab_trains[ab_index-1][0]))
                    ab_index -= 1
            else:
                for i in range(1, -units):
                    heapq.heappush(pq, (ba_trains[ba_index-1][1], ba_trains[ba_index-1][2], -ba_trains[ba_index-1][0]))
                    ba_index -= 1

    return max_units

nab, nba = map(int, input().split())
ab_trains = []
ba_trains = []

for _ in range(nab):
    ci, di, ai = map(int, input().split())
    ab_trains.append((ci, di, ai))

for _ in range(nba):
    ci, di, ai = map(int, input().split())
    ba_trains.append((ci, di, ai))

print(train_king(nab, nba, ab_trains, ba_trains))
```
